intro: Prestonia cogolloi, commonly known as the Cogollo's prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
